DPOs Lobbied: John Sheridan|Councillor|Louth County council::Pearse McGeough|Councillor|Louth County council::Dolores Minogue|Councillor|Louth County council::Emma Coffey|Councillor|Louth County council::Marianne Butler|Councillor|Louth County council::Maria Doyle|Councillor|Louth County council::Liam Reilly|Councillor|Louth County council::Kevin Meenan|Councillor|Louth County council::Tomás Sharkey|Councillor|Louth County council::Maeve Anna Yore|Councillor|Louth County council::Edel Corrigan|Councillor|Louth County council::Sean Kelly|Councillor|Louth County council::Conor Keelan|Councillor|Louth County council::John Reilly|Councillor|Louth County council::Andrea McKevitt|Councillor|Louth County council::Antoín Watters|Councillor|Louth County council::Michelle Hall|Councillor|Louth County council::Tom Cunningham|Councillor|Louth County council::Frank Godfrey|Councillor|Louth County council::Pio Martin Smith|Councillor|Louth County council::Joanna Byrne|Councillor|Louth County council::Kevin Callan|Councillor|Louth County council::James Byrne|Councillor|Louth County council::Paddy McQuillan|Councillor|Louth County council
Intended Results: Housing - To highlight that the county council should not be sterilising rural areas by making it difficult for younger generations of farming families to build their homes.::Natural Heritage, Biodiversity and Green Infrastructure - To highlight that damage caused by increased recreational use in the Carlingford Mountain SAC needs to be acknowledged and a sustainable recreational plan needs to be developed with shareholders and interested parties. Further spread of bracken on the mountain should also be prevented.::To highlight that it is imperative that farming and rural communities are supported so that they in turn can support the rural landscape as they are and have been the custodians of the land for generations.::NH1454 Ardee Cutaway Bog  - The  Ardee Cutaway Bog has been proposed as a NHA and yet this is also a proposed route for the Ardee Bypass.  Louth County Council must ensure that farmers in such areas are supported fairly considering the Council's own willingness to overturn such restrictions when concerning their own projects.::Climate Action  On-farm Renewable Energy projects connecting to the grid via the local Substations should be facilitated and encouraged in the new Plan. A further Renewable Energy initiative that would be beneficial for the County Council to action would be the use of Anaerobic Digesters (AD) to treat domestic waste.::Further Louth IFA Proposals  In regard to the N2 Ardee to Castleblaney Road Project, we continue to ask that Louth County Council, Monaghan County Council and Jacobs Consulting Engineers are transparent and fair with affected landowners. Full compensation must be paid in regard to the loss incurred and that the Compulsory Purchase Order (CPO) Goodwill Payment is restored to €5,000 per acre and adhered to.
